history.content: If you are really ace'ing all those lower div courses, you should be fine. 120 directly builds on 16b, 170 on 70/61b, and 127 on linear algebra/16b (and I'm assuming you probably took linear algebra too before entering Berkeley since you're a transfer student). The problem sets will take a decent amount of time tho, I will admit. You got this dude.

I'm a transfer student and I got A and A- in 16A and 61A respectively. This semester I'm taking CS70, EE16B, and CS61B. 

These are my projected grades for these classes: A/A- in 70, A in 16B, and probably A- in 61B. Overall the semester has been ok not too heavy. I'm gonna guess I'm probably spending 50 hours per week between these 3 classes when projects are due or exams are coming up, but otherwise I didn't think it was "too heavy".

Having said this how will this course load compare to the classes that I would like to take in the fall : EE120, EECS 127, and CS170? 

I originally wanted to take EECS 126 and CS170 + H/SS but I think it would be better to take 126 in the spring since the professor teaching it has a very good reputation. What are your thoughts?
history.subject: Courseload Thoughts: EE127, CS170, EE120
